runs.comm: McCullum starts in style. Aamer dropped it slightly short of length and a touch outside off stump, McCullum lashes it away past point
slightly closer to the off stump, hops back to steer it past backward point
back of length and on the middle and leg , tucked to Razzak at long leg.
tapped to the on side and they rush across for a single. Fawad Alam fires in a slightly wide throw and Umar Gul didn't back up cleanly. Overthrows. Oh well.
dabbed down to third man for a single
again banged in short of length and McCullum rocks back to pull it powerfully to deep backward square leg boundary.

Almost a dream comeback for Razzaq. Shout for lbw but there was a tiny inside edge. It was full and tilted in towards off and middle, Redmond went for the big shot past mid-on, missed and nicked it to his pad
full and moving in again, pushed to mid-on for a single. Very leisurely run and Wasim Akram is not happy with the fielding already. "Wake up guys," he says.
leans forward to push to cover point for a single
Razzaq takes out McCullum. This is his first over after coming back from ICL. A little big moment for him. McCullum walked down the pitch and square drove it hard but straight to point
short in length, straightening outside off, pushed to cover point
in the channel outside off stump, left alone
141. kph length delivery moving away from the off stump and Akmal gathers
Slower, around 126 kph, moving outside off stump, tries to run it down to third man and is beaten.
129.9 kph, cutting away from Redmond who doesn't connect again with the intended dab to third man. Another off cutter from Aamer.
Tired of trying the cute shot and missing, Redmond backed away to the leg side and slashed the back-of-length delivery outside off over backward point
another slow off cutter, moving in from outside leg, nudged to the on side
walks towards middle and off and pushes to wide mid-on for a single
moves forward to swing a length delivery from the middle stump through wide mid-on region.
127.3 kmph delivery, straightening around the off and middle line, defended to the off side
pushes it towards mid-on for a single
moves outside leg stump, Razzaq follows him and cramps him for room, nudged back down the pitch
full and straight, hel lifts it superbly over mid-off for a fine boundary. He struck that very cleanly. Nice smooth swing of the bat.
steers it to third man to retain the strike
Redmond moves down the leg side, Aamer follows him with a length delivery, Redmond tried to carve it over the off-side field but couldn't connect
What a soft dismissal. Aamer serves a full toss on the middle, Redmond tries to heave it over mid-on but mistimes it completely and sends a dolly of a catch to mid-on
moving through the off stump channel and Akmal gathers.
shuffles across to get behind the line of a length delivery around middle and off and pushes it to the off side of the pitch
128.7 kmph short delivery, Styris pulls it down to deep backward square leg
125.2 kmph, off cutter, moving in towards middle, punched through wide mid-on for couple of runs
lands on the length around middle, around 128 kmph, defended to the on side
129.7 kmph full in length, moving in towards leg and middle, skids on, Styris tries to flick, misses and is hit on the pad

Razzaq claims his second victim. What a day for him. It was a typical Razzaq delivery. Tilting in to the right-handed batsman. It was full and it moved in, Guptill missed the attempted flick, and was struck in front of the  leg stump. Hawk eye says it would have clipped the leg stump
128.7 kmph delivery angling away from Oram and rushes past the outside edge
beaten again. It curved away from Oram who flirted with it
length delivery on the middle stump, pushed to the off side. A very fine over from Razzaq.
floated around the off stump, paddled away for a single
flat trajectory, on the middle, full, swept away for a single
nice variation. He slowed up the pace, gave it bit more air and Styris ended up pushing it slightly early and the ball was briefly in the air but falls safely well to the left of the bowler
leans forward to turn to midwicket
off break on the middle stump line, worked to right of midwicket where Afridi rushes across and slides to stop it with his feet but misses
leans forward to tap it close on the leg side and they rush across. Ajmal swoops on the ball, turns to fire in a throw at the non-striker's end but misses
legbreak on the middle, worked to midwicket
sliding down, tries to lap it around the corner, misses but will pick up a leg bye

doesn''t time the paddle sweep well and the ball rolls towards leg slip region. Styris wants a single, unaware of how far the ball had gone, the slip rushes to the on side and threw to Akmal who broke the stumps but Styris had dived home by then. It needed a direct hit.
tries to cover drive the leg break but is beaten
flicks from outside off to backward square leg region
pushes it outside off, skids away , Oram tries the cut shot but doesn't connect
Styris goes for the big shot down the ground. He charged down the track and lifted the doosra over the head of Gul at long-on
drives down the ground to Gul for a single
slower, on the middle stump line and Oram goes down on his knee to paddle sweep it to fine-leg
stretches forward to drive to long-off for a single
on the off stump line, stops a bit on Styris who jabs it to the on side. The pitch is getting slower
the doosra on the off stump line, Styris only picks it off the pitch, and the ball runs off the outer edge to short third man
leans forward to edge a cover drive to his pad
worked through midwicket for a single

Afridi sends Oram back to the hutch. Oram charged down the track for the big hit but only succeeded in skying it straight up. Misbah ran back from extra cover to take a neat catch. New Zealand are wobbling here. 55 for 4.

huge shout for lbw. The skidder on the middle and leg. Styris lunged across, pushed his bat outside the line and ball tilted in to hit the pad. The umpire must have felt it would have missed leg stump
oh superb delivery. This one drifted in before turning away and Styris is beaten; he was shaping to work it to the on side but was surprised by the turn
leans across to dab this through cover point
short in length, flat trajectory, on the middle, flicked past square leg
quickish, on the middle, tapped towards midwicket and they scamper across for a quick single
pushed through quickly again, outside off, dabbed to cover
goes for the reverse sweep but misses it completely and the ball turns in to hit his helmet
quicker, ends up as a full toss around off stump, curving away, driven well through wide mid-off region
turned past square leg for a single

almost cleaned him up with the yorker. Delivered like a seamer, it swung in late, past the hurried jab but some how, missed the stumps. I remember him taking out Steve Waugh in Australia once with a similar delivery.
slightly short in length, cut away to backward point
slower, outside off stump, reverse swept towards short third man and Gul rushes across and dives full stretch to make a very fine stop.
moves outside leg stump and lifts it to Fawad at deep cover
flighted legbreak and Styris lofts it high and to the right of long-on. The fielder rushes back and to his right to prevent the boundary
Gul starts with a delivery well outside off stump, very close to being called a wide, Styris has a big swing and a miss
straighter, fuller, Styris went for the swipe to the on side but edged it along the ground to Akmal
high bouncer well outside off stump. Wide.

What a fabulous catch from Afridi running backwards towards long-on. Styris had found more elevation than distance and it looked to be landing safely. But Afridi had other ideas. He ran full pelt from mid-on and lunged in the end, four or five metres from the boundary, to take a very good catch. It's the dangerous Pakistan that has turned out today. And the tournament is so much better for it.

And Gul gets another wicket with a yorker. McGlashan took couple of steps down the track and tried to sweep it. Not a good idea. The yorker crashed into his pad and he was caught in front of the stumps.
goes for another full delivery but this one swings away late and though it hit the pad, it was missing the leg stump.
in the zone outside off, moving away fractionally and the batsman pushes inside the line. What a start from Umar Gul.
slow through the air, full on the middle, turned to deep midwicket
quicker, skidding on to the middle and leg, flicked along the ground and straight to Shahzaib at short fine-leg who makes a complete mess of it. It went right through him.
pushed well outside off stump
the skidder, coming in with the arm, lands on the middle and leg, the batsman plays for the non-existent leg stump. Lbw shout. The umpire reckoned it might have missed leg stump
outside off stump, nudged to the off side
leans forward to push it to the on side. Another tight over from Afridi.
top edges the sweep right on to his helmet grill and the ball bounds away to square leg
turns in from outside off, dabbed to backward point
from round the stumps, steered towards backward point for another single. Afridi fired in a throw at the striker's end but missed
slows up the pace, tries the reverse sweep, misses and is struck on the body
doosra on the off stump, dabbed to short third man
goes for the sweep, edges it to short fine-leg
bounces on the middle and off line, stabbed to the off side
banged in short of length outside off, upper cut wide of third man and Aamer makes a sliding tumbling stop. Akmal applauds.
another fine yorker, on the leg stump line, and the ball rolls off the pad to the on side
The leg stump has gone for a walk. It was full, it was straight and went past the attempted big hit. Clatter! Pakistan are all over the Kiwis at this point.
full in length, moving through the off-side channel, tries to run it down to third man and is beaten
full and straight, on the middle, edged to the pad. What a fine over again from Gul.
leans forward to turn it past square leg
slows up the pace, swept to long leg
fires in a yorker on the middle stump line, dug out to the short mid-on region
and slows up the pace now, drags the sweep to deep backward square leg
and fires this one. Alternating between slow and quick. Franklin gets his bat down in a hurry and stabs the ball to the off side
And for a change, fires this one in as well. A very good yorker from round the stumps in fact. Franklin is hit on the boot but the ball was tailing down leg side.
swinging yorker, tailing towards middle and off, dug out to the off side
hurls in the bouncer this time and it climbs past Franklin
And what a spell this has been. Another deadly fatal yorker. Another wicket. Franklin was looking to hit across the line. Mistake. The middle stump has been pegged back.

Stand up and applaud. This is the first five-for in Twenty20 internationals. Umar Gul is da Maan. The leg cutter does the trick. The batsman gets a leading edge to cover. Simple catch. 5 for 4 and what's more he is on a hat-trick for the second time today.
length delivery, on the middle, edged to the on side
lifting delivery on the middle and leg, swatted away to midwicket region
slower one but Vettori picks it early, goes down on his knee and swipes it to wide long-on boundary
Vettori goes for the action replay of the previous hit but can't get wood on leather this time
Pakistan have shot out New Zealand for 99. It was dragged to midwicket where Younis makes a sliding stop and fires it to Razzaq who takes the bails off.
